snippet: The ambitious measures aim to reduce new H.I.V. infections to about 750 a year by 2020 from the current 3,000, but more financing is needed.
abstract: Editorial applauds New York Gov Andrew Cuomo's announced plan to reduce new infections of HIV virus in state from 3,000 a year to 750 a year by 2020; holds that officials, in seeking out those who are unaware that they are infected by virus, should also focus on testing young black and Hispanic gay and bisexual men, who are at high risk; also calls for increase of money spent on effort.
lead_paragraph: The ambitious measures aim to reduce new H.I.V. infections to about 750 a year by 2020 from the current 3,000, but more financing is needed.

headline.main: Gov. Cuomo’s Plan to Fight AIDS in New York
headline.print_headline: Gov. Cuomo’s Plan to Fight AIDS in New York
